content.question: Water flows to the right through the pipe shown in the figure. Points <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> lie on the same horizontal line, but the diameter of the pipe at Point <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is smaller than the diameter of the pipe at Point <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Which of the following quantities is the same at both Points <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: The flow rate of the water
The cross-sectional area of the pipe

content.answer: The flow rate of the water

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
